content: You need to designate an email account as the default account. At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button ≡ > Account Settings Select the account to be the default one in the left pane. Select 'Set as Default' from the 'Account Action' drop-down menu at the bottom.
creator: christ1

content:
First, as I already mentioned, I already set the correct SMTP server as default.

Second, I think we see very different things here. I don't have a "≡" menu. I open the account settings via "Edit" > "Account Settings".

There, I have a list of accounts on the left pane, each with several sub-options such as "Server Setting", "Copies and Folders" and so on. I can't select anything as default on this left pane. The right pane changes depending on what I click on in the left pane.

For SMTP, there is an option separate from all the other accounts If I click on that, the right pane shows a list of configured SMTP servers (among other things). This is where I set my default outgoing server.

That's fine.

There, I have a list of accounts on the left pane, each with several sub-options such as "Server Setting", "Copies and Folders" and so on.

Yes, but SMTP settings are irrelevant here. The 'Account Action' drop-down menu is your friend.

content:
Thunderbird 115.4.1(64bit) Running on Fedora 38 KDE Plasma. Thunderbird upgraded tonight 17:00 2023-11-1

You have it better than me as it is as if all my emails have disappeared. I can click on any folder and all I get is the number of unread messages next to its title a blank window and no tallies showing in the status bar. Just down grade to 102.9.1(64bit) and am a happy chappy.

In nearly 20 years of use this is the biggest balls up there has been. It is the old story. If it ain't broken don't fix it. The other one to remember is KISS (keep it simple stupid)

The other thing I hate is the moving of the Toolbar above the Menubar. It is like MS of old where they would make totally useless changes just to make it look like you are getting something new. While you might of under the hood the visual changes were just a distraction.

Years ago I thought of coding my own email client and now I am wishing I had. If Thunderbird carry on in this direction I will be finding another email client because I no longer feel that I can trust it.

content:
default is normally just a relic. But if that is where you found your data, I'm glad you found it.

default-release is the profile which normally will be the default. Is OK to delete it if there is no useful data there. But you should be delete it using Thunderbird, not in your OS file manager. But ...

You haven't explicitly stated which profile is marked default. You cite pointing to C:\Users\carst\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\voq14rh7.default\Mail\Local Folders\Inbox.sbd. Does that mean you changed the properties of of Inbox to point to that location? Or, did you change your default profile from default-release to default?

content:
Hola, Para diagnosticar problemas en Thunderbird, prueba la siguiente solución:

  • Reinicia Thunderbird con los complementos desactivados (Thunderbird en Modo Seguro). En el menú de Ayuda, haz clic en "Reiniciar con los complementos desactivados...". Si Thunderbird funciona bien, hay algún complemento o tema que interfiere en el funcionamiento normal de Thunderbird. Tendrás que volver a activar todos los complementos hasta que localices dónde está el problema.

Saludos

content: Some, if not most, IMAP servers synchronize with the mail app on startup, no matter the settings in TB. That can be avoided if you launch TB in Offline mode (Settings/General/Network & Disk Space).
creator: sfhowes

content: Is the first one a POP account while the second is IMAP? With IMAP, mail is stored on the server and shown in TB when the account is synced. Syncing also means actions in TB are performed on the server, and vice versa.

creator: ccrsedona

content:
ccrsedona said
I can't change that is seems, it's automated from outlook, is there a manual way?

IMAP or POP can be selected on the first screen when adding an account to TB. But if an existing account is POP or IMAP, and you wish to switch to the other type, it's not sufficient to just change the settings:

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Convert_a_POP_account_to_a_IMAP_account

To delete, copy or move multiple messages, select the first message, then hold Shift and select the last messages, then press Delete (or copy or move). Press Ctrl while selecting messages that aren't in a single block.

https://www.lifewire.com/select-multiple-files-in-windows-5217221

content:
Ok, you're upset. We get that. Actually, there was an extensive effort to advise people of this. For example, there was this page: https://blog.thunderbird.net/2023/07/our-fastest-most-beautiful-release-ever-thunderbird-115-supernova-is-here/ and many others. Did you have the startup page turned off? I regret you never got the message. Yes, the look is new, but it works well after some adjustments.

The rollback steps are here, but can be problematic. I suggest doing a backup first: Exit Thunderbird if running. 

   click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

Preferably, I suggest you post what problems you are encountering to see if someone here can assist. The prior versions are at end-of-life, and version 115 is getting many positive reviews. Thank you.

content:
It works here in TB 115/W11, although the process is Send to, Mail Recipient, not Thunderbird. It might be the Outlook installation that corrupted the operation for other mail clients. When these types of MAPI issues occur, it can sometimes be fixed by doing this: download and run the installer for the same version already installed:

https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.4.1/win64/

Choose Advanced setup, set TB as the default, don't run TB at the end of setup, restart the computer. See if Send to works with multiple files.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1323685

Make sure that Outlook is not set as the default - there could be several places in Windows or Outlook settings.

content:
Looks like you are actually seeing the html css source of email as if you were using View > Message Source.

This can sometimes happen if someone sent html content through as plain text Or if something was intervening whilst email was being downloaded eg: AV products OR if AV had been scanning mail storage files OR if you have encoding not set up for both 'Latin' and also 'Other Writing Systems'.

Advise - you do not allow any Anti-Virus product to scan any Thunderbird file in profile as it can cause havoc or even loss of data. This also means do not allow cleanup products like CCleaner or WiseCleaner access to Thunderbird profile. Set up your 'Thunderbird' folder and any folder or file it contains as exempt from access. eg: C://Users/User name/Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird

Check you have the following:

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll down to 'Language & Appearance' - 'Fonts & Colours'
  • Click on 'Advanced' button
  • Fonts for: select 'Latin'
  • Set Proportional Size: eg: 14px
  • Set Monospace Size: eg:14px
  • Set Minimum font Size: eg: 10px
  • Fonts for: select 'Other Writing Systems' - it's at the bottom of drop down list

Set exacly the same sizes you set for 'Latin'

  • Set Proportional Size: eg: 14px
  • Set Monospace Size: eg:14px
  • Set Minimum font Size: eg: 10px
  • Click on 'OK'
creator: Toad-Hall

creator: davidsk

content:
Sounds like you have updated to the new Supernova version. Code needed updating - in fact it needed a complete rewrite, so whilst they did the new design they created more options than before.

Many things can be enabled and disabled, but without knowing what problem you have, I cannot advise.

If you need to know how to modify aspects of it then please ask because saying 'I do not like it' does not offer me any information. Help me to help you. I've uesd it now fo a few weeks and discovered most things are a real improvement. Some things are still being developed.

For example: The new 'Unified Toolbar' replaces the old 'Mail Toolbar'. However, currently, it's not possible to know exactly what you used before, so you have to reselect what you want to see on toolbar. So right click on 'Unified Toolbar' (it has the global search on it) and elect 'Customise' to be able to put all required buttons back onto it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/unified-toolbar

There is also a new way of viewing email list - the old standard one email per line list with column headers called 'Table View' and a new one called 'Card View' which has no column headers and uses at least two lines per email - best used with 'View > Layout > Vertical' otherwise you don't see many emails in list.

Ask away and you might be surprised what is now available and what you switch on or off.
creator: Toad-Hall
